image.altText: woman in gym gear walks in glaring sun along Brisbane River

items.synopsis: Scientists warned us it was close — and now we have data suggesting Tuesday, July 4, 2023, broke the record for the average daily global temperature.

title.children: The world just had its hottest day on record, initial data shows — and experts say it's only going to get hotter

image.altText: ACT court precinct

items.synopsis: A Canberra man avoids more time in prison for choking two teenage boys after a game of 'slap-boxing' gone wrong.

title.children: Canberra man who choked teenagers in apparent revenge for 'slap boxing' game avoids more jail time

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses

items.synopsis: The daughter of a man shot dead by his wife tells the NSW Supreme Court that the image of her father's injured body haunts her every time she shuts her eyes.

title.children: Daughter of man shot dead by his wife says she sees his body every time she closes her eyes

image.altText: Linda Burney wearing white shirt and purple glasses standing in front a podium with a blue background

items.synopsis: Indigenous Australians Minister Linda Burney names four priorities for the proposed Voice to Parliament in a speech to the National Press Club, after growing pressure to detail how it would benefit First Nations people.

title.children: Linda Burney says there is everything to gain and nothing to lose by supporting the Voice

image.altText: A smiling woman stands next to a man, whose face is blurred, in front of a glass door

items.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis — who is accused of administering her parents with lethal doses of medication a year apart — appears in the Adelaide Magistrates Court and is denied bail.

title.children: Daughter accused of murdering her parents allegedly administered lethal doses of medication, court hears

image.altText: A woman in a denim jacket sits with her hands clasped.

items.synopsis: The ACT government has announced a new 14-bed Adolescent Unit as part of the Centenary Hospital expansion after years of young mental health patients calling for a dedicated facility.

title.children: After years of children being admitted to Canberra's Adult Mental Health Unit, a dedicated facility for teens has opened

image.altText: Bright green artificial turf out the front of a house.

items.synopsis: Artificial turf is an increasingly popular choice for suburban backyards, offering an evergreen surface that requires little maintenance. But that convenience comes with a big environmental price tag.

title.children: Thinking about rolling out artificial turf? Experts are urging you to consider natural alternatives

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a blue air force uniform looks grim in front of the side doors to Parliament House.

items.synopsis: Russian cybercriminals claimed to have posted more than 1 terabyte of stolen data on the dark web in June. The firm's clients include the big four banks and the federal health department.

title.children: Massive law firm hack affected government departments, Australia's new cyber security coordinator confirms

image.altText: two older men in paramedic uniforms standing in from of an ambulance

items.synopsis: Paramedics Ray Smyth and Dave Moran made a special trip to a popular beach to give a palliative care patient one last look at the coast, after she told them she met her husband of 65 years on a beach. The following day, she passed away.

title.children: Paramedics take palliative patient for one last look at the coast. The next day, she passed away

image.altText: BRS

items.synopsis: Legal invoices issued to Seven Network and Kerry Stokes' private company are among documents Nine Entertainment has won access to in the Federal Court.

title.children: Nine secures minor win in bid to recover legal costs from Ben Roberts-Smith's backers

image.altText: woman standing looking down barrel holding baby boy, she has brown hair and is wearing glasses, baby has big blue eyes

items.synopsis: Home owners are struggling with increasing repayments amid reports that regional house prices have stagnated, despite interest rates staying on hold on Tuesday.

title.children: 'We've gone backwards': Young family sells home because they can't afford repayments, interest rate pause no help

image.altText: A young girl with dark black hair, wearing jeans and a denim jacket, sits cross legged and smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Young murder victim Jasmeen Kaur, 21, was forced to endure an "uncommon level of cruelty" after she was abducted by her ex-partner, who buried her alive, an Adelaide court is told.

title.children: 'Absolute terror': Young woman murdered by ex-partner was stalked, abducted and buried alive

image.altText: A close up of a smiling woman wearing a traditional dress on a Bhutanese square.

items.synopsis: After centuries of isolation, Bhutan opened its doors to tourism in the 1970s. But when the ABC was granted rare entry into the country, it found a nation losing a high proportion of people — mainly to Australia.

title.children: 'It feels so empty': The forbidden kingdom of Bhutan is turning into a ghost town

image.altText: A screenshot from the Barbie trailer showing Margot Robbie in front of a crudely drawn world map.

items.synopsis: Maps can be very touchy subjects. That's why Vietnam has banned the Barbie movie, writes Donald Rothwell.

title.children: Barbie's world map makes no sense, but even it can cause an international incident

image.altText: An elderly woman with white hair and glasses is pictured with a young woman and a red-haired girl in a children's playground

items.synopsis: A bill for a dedicated palliative care facility to be built in Mount Gambier to service South Australia's south-east has passed parliament.

title.children: Families could soon have better end-of-life care as proposed palliative care facility gets green light

image.altText: A crowd of men and women stand looking serious, Littleproud and Price at the fore.

items.synopsis: Senior members of the Nationals are locking in behind David Littleproud amid leadership chatter, adding they're "not worried at all".

title.children: 'Absolute nonsense': Nationals rule out leadership challenge amid tensions over climate policy

image.altText: A smiling woman with white hair.

items.synopsis: NSW Police Senior Constable Kristian White appears in court via video link charged with tasering 95-year-old dementia patient Clare Nowland, who died days later.

title.children: Magistrate 'disgusted' with prosecutors as police officer charged with tasering 95yo faces court via video link

image.altText: A woman wearing pink pulling gym equipment

items.synopsis: A world-first study from Australian researchers has found the likely reason why breast cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy commonly experience reduced cognitive function.

title.children: Deirdre's brain fog was so bad she forgot what day it was. Scientists now know why

image.altText: An empty school corridor.

items.synopsis: The woman is accused of the indecent treatment of a child under 16. The offences are alleged to have occurred between June 2015 and July 2016.

title.children: Woman facing nearly 80 charges over alleged abuse of Gold Coast teenager

image.altText: An old grainy photo of a smiling young woman with dark hair, a blue top and silver necklace, her hand held up to her right ear.

items.synopsis: WA Police reveal a male DNA profile has been found in their renewed investigation into the murder of the 22-year-old more than four decades ago.

title.children: DNA breakthrough in WA cold case murder has police 'excited' about 'genealogy' ID technique

image.altText: A small boat upturned in dark blue ocean.

items.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority was alerted to the emergency this morning. The survivors are reportedly suffering from mild hypothermia.

title.children: Four people rescued 17 hours after boat capsizes off WA coast

image.altText: A serious-looking Chinese woman in a blue suit stands at a podium and gestures with her hand.

items.synopsis: Australian citizen and legal scholar Kevin Yam, and former Hong Kong politician Ted Hui, who fled the island and now lives in Adelaide, are among eight people wanted for alleged breaches under the controversial National Security Law.

title.children: China accuses Australia of 'flagrant slandering' as Hong Kong doubles down on arrest warrants for Australian residents

image.altText: A young blonde woman smiles while sitting on the beach at sunset.

items.synopsis: A committal hearing in Townsville has heard two drivers were allegedly encouraging each other to go "faster and faster" in the lead-up to the 2021 death of aspiring police officer Jennifer Board.

title.children: 'Insane, unsafe, stupid game' was playing out at 180kph before crash that killed 22-year-old, court hears

image.altText: A large construction site at a hospital in NSW.

items.synopsis: The ABC has been told the young man was crushed at about 9am. He was admitted to John Hunter Hospital, where the work was taking place, but did not survive.

title.children: 20-year-old dies after being crushed at NSW hospital construction site

image.altText: A man holds a child

items.synopsis: Inquest finds the man known as BS may have fallen "between the cracks" of mental health support services after presenting himself to hospital weeks before he killed his young son.

title.children: Lack of mental health support for Sydney father before he stabbed 5yo son to death, inquest finds

image.altText: The NRL logo on a building with clouds above it

items.synopsis: Players will boycott game-day media commitments, including during State of Origin III, as part of an ongoing CBA dispute between the NRL and the RLPA.

title.children: Players insist NRL media blackout 'not about turning backs on fans'

image.altText: A composite of Ash Barty and her newborn baby.

items.synopsis: Former world number one tennis player Ash Barty announces the birth of her first child, Hayden.

title.children: 'Our beautiful boy': Australian tennis great Ash Barty gives birth to son

image.altText: Children are escorted to safety by their rescuers

items.synopsis: Police say 16 children in the Philippines have been "removed from harm" by local authorities after a major, international child protection investigation.

title.children: Airport luggage search in Australia leads to the rescue of 16 children from alleged sexual abuse overseas

image.altText: A man with black short hair and glasses

items.synopsis: Women who were secretly filmed by breast surgeon Ho Keun Shin tell an Adelaide court of the impact his crimes have has had on their lives, with one saying he has impacted her "ability to breastfeed my child without fear of being violated again".

title.children: 'Shocked, humiliated, angry': Breast surgeon's indecent filming victims describe violation

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and bright blue glasses looks over the shoulder of a police officer sitting at an office desk

items.synopsis: The visit to the Joint Emergency Services Communications Centre came as part of coronial inquests into the domestic violence deaths of four Indigenous women in the Northern Territory.

title.children: '135 jobs to be dispatched': NT coroner spends a night at the emergency call centre

image.altText: A flat white drone with four rotors in flight with trees in the background.

items.synopsis: The Defence Department, police and border agents have grounded DJI drones over security concerns, but questioning from one senator has confirmed the devices are still used widely across government.

title.children: DJI drones in wide use across government departments despite defence, Border Force bans

image.altText: dog digging

items.synopsis: They're our furry, four-legged best friends, but dogs — like all pets — come with their challenges. We asked for your curly questions on canine ownership and you sent through hundreds. Here are some of the more common experiences, and our experts' advice.

title.children: You sent our experts hundreds of questions on dog behaviour. Here's what we learnt

image.altText: A screen that says "Artificial Intelligence" and "ChatGPT" above a keyboard. A silver statuette is in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Education Minister Blair Boyer says it is essential that students learn to use AI safely before they graduate. The trial is set to run for two months, after which a decision about a broader rollout will be made.

title.children: ChatGPT-style app to be trialled in schools to teach AI safety

image.altText: Thunderbirds players hug each other with smiles on their faces

items.synopsis: After years of neglect, the South Australian government is expected to announce significant investment in Netball SA Stadium, a move spurred on by the Adelaide Thunderbirds' first grand final appearance since 2013.

title.children: Thunderbirds set to be rewarded with stadium upgrade after securing Super Netball grand final berth

image.altText: A bus that has crashed into a suburban home

items.synopsis: Two people have been taken to hospital after a bus crashed into two houses at Safety Beach, on Melbourne's Mornington Peninsula.

title.children: 'There was a bus in our living room': Bus ploughs into homes after collision with cement truck
